item.title: By: Eric
item.dc:creator: Eric
item.description:
Hi Henry, it really comes down to your tire... but most likely yes, you will need lots of camber.
Stock, the car uses eccentric bolts, which maxes out depending on your ride height. I'm now running -3.5 degrees all around and the tires are still rubbing
item.content:encoded:
Hi Henry, it really comes down to your tire… but most likely yes, you will need lots of camber.

Stock, the car uses eccentric bolts, which maxes out depending on your ride height. I’m now running -3.5 degrees all around and the tires are still rubbing

item.title: By: Henry
item.dc:creator: Henry
item.description:
Hi mate, awesome car. Was thinking of getting the same wheels and spec for my MX5 but Im wondering, do you need much camber to fit them ? If so are they with standard camber arms or after market. New to MX5 so wondering about camber adjustments for them.
Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Hi mate, awesome car. Was thinking of getting the same wheels and spec for my MX5 but Im wondering, do you need much camber to fit them ? If so are they with standard camber arms or after market. New to MX5 so wondering about camber adjustments for them.

Thanks
